title: How to Make a Mosaic from Broken Tiles

steps.title: Sketch a basic drawing of your design.
steps.content: Sketch a basic drawing of your design. Think about what you want the mosaic to look like when it’s finished and draw it out. This can be as detailed as you want, but it just has to give you a guide. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Buy ceramic tiles at a hardware or floor store.
steps.content: Buy ceramic tiles at a hardware or floor store. Pay attention to things like color and texture. You could also go dumpster diving to find old tiles. You may want to purchase a tile cutter if you are looking for a dramatic, organized mosaic with square pieces. You should also buy some tile adhesive and cement. If your mosaic will be used where it may be subjected to freezing temperatures, the tiles should be porcelain that is frost resistant.

steps.title: Throw or drop the tiles.
steps.content: Throw or drop the tiles. With your safety glasses and protective gloves on, throw your tiles at any hard object, or simply drop them. In order to avoid major scratches, lay a thin comforter over the ground. Or, score and cut with the tile cutter. These are great stress relievers and they don't hurt anyone. [2] X Research source Gather your broken tiles into color categories. This will help you when the time comes to actually put them into place.

steps.title: Lay the pieces on the surface you’re decorating.
steps.content: Lay the pieces on the surface you’re decorating. Arrange them in the design you want, then slide them into the wooden frame. They might scatter a little, but if you are careful, it shouldn’t be too bad. Slide the attempted escapees back into place, then individually glue each piece down with the tile adhesive.

steps.title: Pour the cement all over the tiles.
steps.content: Pour the cement all over the tiles. Once the tiles have set, mix up the cement with water until it is of the consistency described on the cement bag (liquid but not runny). Spread the mixture over the tiles, then use a soft cloth to rub off the excess that covers the pieces. You now have a beautiful mosaic! [3] X Research source
